DataElement.preferredName: Defibrotide Sodium Agent Course One Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator to determine whether the first course of defibrotide sodium agent was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Defibrotide Sodium Agent Course One Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A polydeoxyribonucleotide with antithrombotic, thrombolytic, and fibrinolytic properties.  Defibrotide induces the release of prostaglandin 12 and reduces the expression of adhesion molecules on endothelial cells, thereby interfering with platelet and leukocyte adhesion to the endothelium. (NCI04)_An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding._The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.
